verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي مَرْيَمَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ الْحَصْبَةِ فَقَالَ كَانَ أَبِي يَنْزِلُ الْأَبْطَحَ قَلِيلًا ثُمَّ يَجِي‏ءُ وَ يَدْخُلُ الْبُيُوتَ مِنْ غَيْرِ أَنْ يَنَامَ بِالْأَبْطَحِ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ أَ رَأَيْتَ إِنْ تَعَجَّلَ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ إِنْ كَانَ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْيَمَنِ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يُحَصِّبَ قَالَ لَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Aban, from Abu Maryam, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having been asked about Al-Hasba. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘My<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> used to encamp at Al-Abtah. Then he<sup>asws</sup> would go and enter the houses from without sleeping in Al-Abtah’. So I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘What is your<sup>asws</sup> view if someone departs during the two days, if he was from the people of Al-Yemen, would it be upon him that he (encamps) at Hasba?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No’.
